title: The Biggest April Fools' Day Prank

content.en: Happy April Fools' Day! Today is a fun day of pranks and laughs!
content.tw: 愚人節快樂! 今天很好玩，可以盡情整人。

content.en: A British TV show played one of the biggest pranks almost 70 years ago. The show is about what is happening in the world. People learn many things.
content.tw: 70 年前，英國一個電視節目開了超級大玩笑，這個節目通常告訴觀眾世界各地的知識。

content.en: The show said that spaghetti grew on trees! It showed farmers in Switzerland. They were picking spaghetti from trees. It showed them drying spaghetti in the warm sun. It said the farmers worked hard to grow spaghetti that was the same length!
content.tw: 節目騙觀眾義大利麵長在樹上，還拍到瑞士農夫從樹上採義大利麵、拿去曬太陽，努力讓每一根都一樣長！

content.en: Some people called the TV station. They wanted to grow spaghetti too! The station told them to put spaghetti in a can of tomato sauce!
content.tw: 有一些人想種義大利麵，所以詢問電視台，他們回答可以把義大利麵放進番茄醬裡種。

content.en: Of course, spaghetti doesn't grow on trees. And it doesn't grow in a can of tomato sauce.
content.tw: 當然囉，義大利麵不會從樹上冒出來，番茄醬也不行。

content.en: But seventy years ago, not many British people ate spaghetti. And the TV show had told them about many real things before. So, many people thought spaghetti grew on trees.
content.tw: 但是七十年前義大利麵沒這麼普及，而且這個節目平常很正經，所以好多人上當，真的相信這個惡作劇!

content.en: Anything can happen on April Fools' Day! Have fun and have a good laugh with your friends and family!
content.tw: 愚人節什麼事都有可能發生! 希望你和家人朋友都能玩得開心，笑得開心!

vocabulary.preface: 很多人喜歡在愚人節捉弄朋友，引以為樂。

content.text:
1) biggest 最大的。
Wake up, Paz! 快醒來!
It's marathon day today! 今天要跑馬拉松。
What? I want to sleep. 什麼，我還要睡。
No, you want to run in the biggest marathon in Taipei!
不對，你要參加台北最大的馬拉松!

2) friend 朋友。
Wait, is that today? 等一下，是今天嗎?
Yeah, come on! 是今天，快點 !
You're gonna be late! 你要遲到了!
Oh, no, all my friends will be cheering for me! 糟糕，我的朋友都會替我加油!

3) almost 幾乎。
That's right, so get dressed! 對呀，趕快穿衣!
It's almost 5 now. 現在快五點了。
Running starts at 6! 賽跑六點就開始。

4) fool 愚笨的人
Okay, I'm going out now. 好，那我現在出門。
Hey, Jane, today's April Fools' Day, isn't it? 今天是愚人節吧?

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你記住了嗎?
biggest最大的 friend朋友 almost幾乎 fool愚笨的人

quiz.question: 1. What day is April Fools' Day?
2. Where was the spaghetti story shown?
3. Why did the TV station show the spaghetti story?
options: a. To make more people eat spaghetti
b. To show how to grow spaghetti
c. To play an April Fools' Day prank

title: The World's Longest Limo

content.en: Whoa … that car is so long! Is someone famous inside? Everyone is taking photos!
content.tw: 哇！大家怎麼都在拍這台好長的車子？裡面載著什麼人呢？

content.en: Limos are long, expensive cars. Some are very long. They look like they've been pulled and pulled longer and longer…
content.tw: 禮車是一種又長又昂貴的車，看起來就像整輛車被一直拉長、一直拉長！

content.en: The world's longest limo is more than thirty meters long! It's made of six limos! It has 26 wheels! Seventy-five people can ride in it!
content.tw: 這輛世界上最長的禮車超過 30 公尺！它由 6 台車連接起來，總共有 26 個輪子，裡面能坐 75 個人！

content.en: This limo's name is "The American Dream." It has a waterbed, a swimming pool, and … a mini golf course! A helicopter can land by the pool!
content.tw: 這台禮車叫「美國夢」，裡面裝有水床、游泳池，甚至還有迷你高爾夫球場，直升機還能停在游泳池旁邊！

content.en: The American Dream was built about 40 years ago. It was very famous. Everyone wanted to see it! It was on magazine covers, on TV, and in movies! Then... everyone forgot The American Dream...
content.tw: 這台 40 歲的美國夢曾經非常有名，出現在雜誌封面和電影裡，直到大家漸漸忘了它。

content.en: But many years later, a man who likes big cars bought it. He spent 8 million Taiwan dollars to fix it! The world's longest limo is nice and new again!
content.tw: 多年後，一個禮車迷把它買下，花了相當於八百萬台幣裝潢和修理，現在世界最長的禮車又跟新的一樣！

content.en: Now go and find 74 friends to share The American Dream with!
content.tw: 現在去找 74 個朋友一起分享這個美國夢吧！

vocabulary.preface: 超長的禮車「美國夢」，曾經讓很多人嚮往。

content.text:
1. ride 搭乘.
Did you hear? 你聽說了嗎?
Lisa wants to rent a limo for her wedding! 麗莎想要為她的婚禮租一部禮車。
A limo? Wow, I'd like to ride in it! 禮車?哇，我想要搭那部車!

2. inside 在裡面.
It must be very big inside. 裡面一定很大。
I heard that she spent a lot of money on it. 聽說她花了很多錢租車。

3. forget 忘記.
Maybe she's hoping for a wedding no one can forget.也許她希望有個大家都忘不了的婚禮。
Oh, I want to be her bridesmaid! 我要當她的伴娘!

4. dream 夢想.
Just because of the limo? 就因為那部禮車嗎?
Yeah, and it's also my dream to get married someday.
對，也是我夢想有一天我也能結婚。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很有用喔! 請跟我讀一遍。
ride搭乘 inside在裡面 forget忘記 dream夢想

2. How many wheels does the world's longest limo have?
3. Where can a helicopter land on the world's longest limo?
options: a. On the mini golf course

title: Taiwan's Hotels Cut Plastic Use

content.en:
April is a great time to travel in Taiwan. You can stay at a hotel. Put some
clothes in a bag and you're ready!
content.tw: 四月最適合旅行，趕快打包行李吧！

content.en:
But wait! There's a new law! Hotels in Taiwan used to give you some free
things. But now, they can't. Those are the things you throw away after using
them one time.
content.tw: 咦...等等！新法規上路，台灣的飯店不再提供用過就扔的物品。

content.en:
This law started on January 1st. Hotels can't give you toothbrushes, combs,
or shower caps. Bring your own! And now hotels are using big bottles for
shampoo and soap. They fill the bottles again and again. Goodbye, cute mini
bottles!
content.tw:
從 1 月 1
號開始，塑膠牙刷、梳子和浴帽飯店不再提供，洗髮精和沐浴乳都改為大瓶子裝，用完就倒入新的，迷你塑膠瓶都消失了！

content.en:
This law means 460 million plastic bottles won't be needed every year. That
cuts Taiwan's plastic use by 30 percent!
content.tw: 這樣每年能省下 4.6 億個塑膠瓶，降低台灣 30 %的塑膠使用量！

content.en:
Most people didn't want this law a few years ago. But now, people see these
small changes to their hotel stays aren't so bad. They see these small
changes make a big change for Taiwan's environment.
content.tw: 之前有許多旅客抗議，但旅客開始接受這些小改變，看見它們對環境巨大的影響力。

content.en:
Let's all help cut plastic waste. Be ready for your hotel stay! Remember to
bring everything you need!
content.tw: 讓我們一起減少塑膠垃圾，準備好你的旅行！記得帶上你需要的東西！

vocabulary.preface: 現在出門旅行，通常需要自己準備清潔用品。

content.text:
1. soap 肥皂.
Gosh, I'm dead tired! 天哪，我累死了!
You should be. 你應該累。
We climbed a mountain today. 我們今天爬了一座山。
Now I just want to clean up. 現在我只想盥洗。
Hey, there's no soap here! 這裡沒有肥皂!

2. bring 攜帶.
And no towels! 也沒有毛巾!
What's wrong with this place? 這地方是怎麼了?\nCan't help you there. 我幫不了你。
I didn't bring any of those either. 那些東西我也都沒帶。

3. need 需要.
What should we do? I need soap. 我們怎麼辦? 我需要肥皂。
Maybe you can use shampoo? 也許你可以用洗髮精?

4. travel 旅行.
I guess I have to. 只好這樣。
When did traveling become so unfriendly? 旅行什麼時候變這麼不友善?\nBut it's friendly to the Earth. 對地球很友善吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
Let's read today's vocabulary.
soap肥皂 bring攜帶 need需要 travel旅行

2. Why can't hotels give free things that will be used one time?
3. How many plastic bottles won't be needed every year now?

title: Golden Bricks You Can Eat

content.en: Many things give people ideas for new foods. The full moon gave someone the idea for mooncakes. An old story gave someone the idea for cute Christmas gingerbread houses.
content.tw: 有些食物的靈感，從意想不到的地方得來，像是月餅造型從滿月而來，薑餅屋的由來則是從一篇老故事！

content.en: In Puli Township in Nantou, strong old brick houses gave people the idea for a new bread. After a big earthquake many years ago, these brick houses kept standing!
content.tw: 南投埔里的老磚頭屋也成了一種麵包的靈感。這些屋子在地震後，竟然還是站得好好的！

content.en: Making the bread is a lot of work. It has wild rice stems in it. They are grown in Puli. The bakers cut the wild rice stems into long, thin pieces. They fry the pieces to dry them. Then they put walnuts and the fried wild rice stems in bread dough.
content.tw: 做這種麵包可不簡單！它需要特別的食材菰草，是在埔里種的！麵包師傅會把菰草切成長長的細條，炸成乾，再與核桃一起加進麵糰裡。

content.en: The bakers bake the bread for six hours. When it is ready, they cut it into big pieces. The wild rice stems look like straws. The walnuts look like small stones. The bread looks like a brick from Puli's strong brick houses!
content.tw: 麵糰會烤 6 小時，然後被切成塊狀。菰草長得像稻草，核桃則像小石頭，而整個麵包長得像埔里堅固房子的磚塊！

content.en: Puli's golden brick bread is more than food. It shows how strong Puli is. People say the bread tastes good. Would you like to try it?
content.tw: 埔里的金磚麵包不只是食物，它代表了埔里的堅強。人們說這個麵包很好吃，你想試試嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 能抵抗地震的老房子，啟發了麵包師傅。

content.text:
1. Christmas 耶誕節。
Look, a gingerbread house! 你看，薑餅屋!
We're so far from Christmas, and here's a gingerbread house.我們離耶誕節還大老遠，就已經有薑餅屋了。

2. baker 麵包師傅。
I guess the baker wants to celebrate ahead of time.我猜麵包師傅想提前慶祝。
This must be a fun baker. 這一定個好玩的師傅。
Let's buy some bread here.我們來買點兒麵包。

3. bake 烘烤。
It smells great here! 這裡好香啊!
Nothing compares with freshly-baked bread. 什麼都比不上剛烤好的麵包。

4. piece 片。
Oh, I want this one, the raisin walnut toast. 我想要買這個，葡萄乾核桃吐司。
And I want these pieces of pita bread. 我要買這些一片片的披塔餅。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字可有用了，我們來讀一遍。

quiz.question: 1. What gave people the idea for the new bread?
2. Why do the bakers fry the wild rice stems?
3. How long do the bakers bake the bread?

title: Turning Driftwood into Useful Things

content.en: Hualien has been hit by some big earthquakes and typhoons since last April. They made trees fall down! They also made trees break into smaller pieces of wood. The wind pushed the wood into the ocean. There, it became driftwood!
content.tw: 去年四月到現在，花蓮很多的樹，都因為大地震跟颱風倒下，被雨水或是風帶到海裡，成了漂流木!

content.en: Now there is too much driftwood on Hualien's beaches. One typhoon left 13,000 tons of it! People go to the beaches to take pictures of it!
content.tw: 現在花蓮海灘堆滿了漂流木，光是一場颱風就留下了 1 萬 3000 噸！許多人特別拍下這個景象。

content.en: But so much driftwood is not good for the beaches. People can take big pieces to make furniture or art. But what about all the small driftwood?
content.tw: 太多漂流木成了問題，大的漂流木可以做成家具，小的漂流木怎麼處理呢?

content.en: Scientists have found new ways to use it. They break it into smaller pieces. Then they burn it to make fuel.
content.tw: 科學家想到新方法，把木頭分解成碎片，燃燒之後能做成燃料!

content.en: When this happens, the wood becomes hard, black, and gray. It's charcoal! It can help plants grow. Farmers are using it on their land. It can also be used to make homes for fish and other ocean animals!
content.tw: 木頭燃燒會成為灰黑色的木炭，農夫可以撒在土地上，幫助植物生長! 還可以當成海底生物和小魚的家!

content.en: Scientists are making useful things for the land and the ocean from driftwood! One day Hualien's beaches will be clean and beautiful again!
content.tw: 科學家正在把漂流木變成有用的東西，讓花蓮的海灘再次乾淨美麗!

vocabulary.preface: 把漂流木燒成焦炭，可以作為肥料或是海洋生物的家。

content.text:
1. typhoon 颱風.
Did you hear a typhoon is coming? 你有聽說颱風要來了嗎?
In April? I can't believe it! 四月颱? 真的不敢相信!
Will it hit us directly? 會直接侵襲我們嗎?
No, it's not coming to Taipei. 不會，它不來台北。

2. hit 襲擊.
The weatherman said it should hit Taitung. 氣象預報員說他會撲向台東。
Poor Taitung! They get hit every time. 可憐的台東，每次都被打到。

3. furniture 家具.
But they can get a lot of driftwood! 但是他們可以得到好多漂流木。
What's the use of that? 那有什麼用?
You can make furniture or art pieces out of it. 可以用它來做家具或是藝術作品。

4. wind 風.
So heavy rain and strong winds are all okay? 所以強風豪雨都沒關係?
I'm just looking at the bright side. 我只是在看光明面。

vocabulary.postscript: typhoon颱風 hit襲擊 furniture家具 wind風

2. How many tons of driftwood did one typhoon leave?
3. What is the charcoal used for?

title: Glasses Help Deaf People

content.en: A ten-year-old girl can't hear anything at all. She is deaf. She talks with her hands, using sign language. Many people don't know sign language. It was hard for her to talk with them.
content.tw: 有個十歲的女孩耳朵聽不見，她用手語跟人溝通，但遇到不懂手語的人，就十分困擾。

content.en: But one day her mother gave her new glasses. They are for deaf people! Now, when people say something, their words show on the glasses! The glasses work with a smartphone app. They're very fast!
content.tw: 但是有一天，媽媽給了她一副新眼鏡，當別人講話時，搭配手機軟體使用，眼鏡會立刻顯示字幕，非常方便！

content.en: Now the girl knows what people are saying! She can see everything around her, and read the words on her glasses, at the same time!
content.tw: 現在女孩知道其他人在說什麼，她用眼鏡看世界的同時，也閱讀大家講話的字幕。

content.en: The glasses are also helping the girl talk better. She can't hear what she is saying. Before, she didn't know when she said a word right. Now she says a word again and again. When the glasses show the word, she knows she can say it right!
content.tw: 眼鏡也幫助女孩講話更清楚。以前她不知道自己講錯話，現在她重複念一個字，當眼鏡的字幕出現是這個字，她就知道自己講對了！

content.en: These glasses make the girl happier. They also make her more confident.
content.tw: 這副眼鏡讓女孩更快樂，也更有自信。

content.en: Glasses change the lives of people who can't see well. Now these new glasses are changing the lives of people who can't hear!
content.tw: 科技化的眼鏡，讓聽不見的人也能更好地溝通!

vocabulary.preface: 科技化的眼鏡，可以幫助更多人!

content.text:
1. glasses 眼鏡。
Where are my glasses? 我的眼鏡呢?
I can't find my glasses! 我找不到我的眼鏡!
They are right on top of your head! 它就在你頭上。
Oh, nice! Thank you! 真好，謝謝!

2. read 閱讀。
I need the glasses for reading the newspapers. 我需要眼鏡來讀報紙。
Almost all newspapers are online now. 現在幾乎所有的報紙都上網了。

3. word 字。
You can make the words bigger, and read them on your cellphone.
你可以讓字變大，並且在手機上讀。
No more need for glasses. 不再需要眼鏡了。

4. use 使用。
No, I love my glasses.不，我喜歡眼鏡。
I use them to read the maps on the street. 我用它在街上看地圖。
Every time I do that, people would come and help me.
每次我那樣做，都會有人來幫我。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我一起讀單字。
glasses眼鏡 read閱讀 word字 use使用

2. What do the glasses do with the words people say?

title: Toilet Shows Where A King Lived

content.en: What do archaeologists do? They find out about the lives of people long ago. They go to very old places.
content.tw: 考古學家做什麼呢? 他們到古老的地方探索，嘗試了解古時候的人如何生活！

content.en: Many old things from these old places are in the ground. Archaeologists carefully dig in the ground to find them. They study the old things they find. These things show how people lived a long time ago!
content.tw: 許多古老的東西藏在地底，考古學家會小心挖出來研究，了解以前生活的秘密!

content.en: Maybe someone finds an old horseshoe. It shows someone long ago had a horse. Maybe the person was a poor farmer. Maybe he was a strong soldier. Maybe she was a rich queen! Archaeologists try to find out!
content.tw: 找到馬蹄鐵，就表示有人曾經有一匹馬，是貧窮的農夫、強壯士兵還是有錢的皇后呢?

content.en: Some archaeologists were looking for a king's home in England. The king lived 1,000 years ago! Now, they think they found it.
content.tw: 有一些考古學家想要找一個 1000 年前英格蘭國王的皇宮，現在好像找到了!

content.en: Why do they think so? They found a toilet in a big home! Toilets in homes were for rich people then. And the king was rich!
content.tw: 因為他們在一個大房子裡發現廁所，而 1000 年前，只有國王這種富翁家裡有廁所。

content.en: A 1,000-year-old toilet showed archaeologists about a king. One thousand years from now, what will show archaeologists about us?
content.tw: 一個 1000 年前的廁所，讓考古學家了解國王的生活。那麼，1000 年後，什麼會讓考古學家了解我們呢?

vocabulary.preface: 考古學家研究出土的古物，希望多了解人類的歷史。

content.text:
1. dig 挖掘。
If you could dig up an ancient person's tomb, 如果你能挖出一名古人的墓，who would you like to find? 你會想找到誰?
I'd like to find Cleopatra. 我想找克麗奧派區啦。

2. long ago 很久以前。
Cleopatra? Queen of Egypt? 那位埃及艷后嗎?
Yeah. 沒錯。
She lived very long ago. 她活在古早年代。
Over two thousand years ago.超過兩千年前。

3. rich 富有的。
Why her? 為什麼想找她呢?
She was a very beautiful and rich woman. 她是一位美麗又多金的女士。
And also the ruler of a country. 還是國家的統治者。

4. soldier 士兵。
Her tomb would be protected by soldiers. 她的墳墓會有士兵保護。
I'm not worried. They died a long time ago. 我不擔心。他們很早以前就掛了。

vocabulary.postscript:
你記住今天的單字了嗎?
dig挖掘 long ago很久以前 rich富有的 soldier士兵

quiz.question: 1. Who finds out about people who lived long ago?
2. Where are many old things?
3. Where was the king's home?

title: A New Way to Wash Your Helmet

content.en: Scooters are fun, let's go for a ride! But, hey, the most important thing is to be safe. Put on a helmet!
content.tw: 搭機車兜風很好玩，但不要忘記戴安全帽哦!

content.en: In Taiwan, we wear helmets when we ride scooters. Helmets keep us safe in the sun, rain, and wind. But they're hot. They make us sweat.
content.tw: 台灣機車騎士都戴安全帽，安全又遮風擋雨擋太陽，但它們很悶熱，讓騎士流汗!

content.en: Dirty helmets need to be washed. But washing them isn't easy. We can't wash them in washing machines for clothes. So, many of us don't wash our helmets. That makes them smell bad! Eww …
content.tw: 流過汗的安全帽要清洗，但很多人不知道怎麼洗，所以安全帽總是髒髒臭臭!

content.en: It's important to wash dirty helmets. There are many germs inside them. Germs can make little white pieces of skin fall off our heads. Eww! Germs can make little red spots on our heads. Dirty helmets can make our heads itch!
content.tw: 安全帽不洗的話，會累積細菌，讓我們掉頭皮屑或是長紅班，還會頭皮超級癢!

content.en: Now someone has made a helmet washer! But it doesn't use water or soap. It uses light that kills germs. It also makes smells go away. Washing takes eight minutes. That's fast!
content.tw: 有人發明洗安全帽機，不用水或肥皂，而是照一道光，能殺菌跟除臭味，八分鐘就洗好!

content.en: There are about 400 helmet washers in Taiwan. They don't cost much money to use.
content.tw: 全台灣有 400 台洗安全帽機，可以便宜使用，趕快去洗你的臭安全帽吧!

content.en: So... what are you waiting for? Go wash your helmet!
content.tw: 那你還在等什麼? 趕快去洗你的安全帽吧!

vocabulary.preface: 安全帽可以保護頭部，但是戴久了會有衛生問題。

content.text:
1. wash 洗。
Uh oh, I forgot my helmet! 糟了，我忘了安全帽!
I washed it and left it at home.我把它洗了，留在家裡。

2. dirty 髒的。
Why did you wash it? 為什麼要洗?
Because it's dirty, that's why.因為它髒掉了，就那個原因。
I've never done that. 我從來沒洗過。
You've never washed your helmet? Yuck! 你從來沒洗過安全帽? 好噁喔!

3. sweat 出汗。
I'm sure it's clean. 我確定它滿乾淨的。
No, you wear it every day, and you sweat. 不，你每天戴，又流汗。

4. head 頭。
Don't put it on your head anymore. 不要再戴到頭上了。
Your hair may fall off. 可能會掉頭髮呢!
Alright, stop it. I'll do it tonight! 好了，別說了，我今晚就來洗。

vocabulary.postscript:
搭乘摩托車也要戴安全帽喔!
wash洗 dirty髒的 sweat出汗 head頭

title: Black Soldier Fly Babies Help the Earth

content.en: Baby flies are called larvae. They have no legs or wings. They are very small. One kind of larvae is black soldier fly larvae. These larvae can make something good!
content.tw: 蒼蠅的小寶寶叫做蛆，牠們沒有腳或翅膀，有一種蛆叫黑水虻，牠們可以做厲害的事情!

content.en: Black soldier fly larvae eat and eat. They can eat lots of food waste. That's the food we don't eat. Eating it is good for the Earth. But that's not all they do.
content.tw: 黑水虻超級會吃，特別愛吃廚餘，這對地球很有幫助!不過，牠們可不只這樣!

content.en: They poop! Their poop is called frass. These larvae make lots of frass! And that's good for the Earth too. Why?
content.tw: 牠們還很會大便! 那些大便叫做蟲糞，對地球也非常好!為什麼呢?

content.en: Frass can make soil healthy. Healthy soil helps plants grow better. Frass also helps soil hold water longer. So frass can be great for farms!
content.tw: 蟲糞讓土壤健康，植物可以長得更好，蟲糞也讓泥土更能保持水分，農夫很喜歡!

content.en: Frass is also natural. Some farms use natural ways to grow food. But in some countries, these farms cannot use frass. The countries have not okayed the use of frass.
content.tw: 蟲糞是天然肥料，所以很多農場用它施肥，但有一些國家目前是禁止使用的。

content.en: So now, scientists and farmers are trying to change this. They are teaching more people about frass.
content.tw: 所以現在科學家和農夫們，努力向大家宣導蟲糞的好處!

content.en: One day, black soldier fly larvae frass may help farms all over the world. These small larvae can help the Earth with their frass!
content.tw: 黑水虻的蟲糞，將來可能會幫助全世界的農場，這些小小的蛆，能用牠們的蟲糞幫助地球!

vocabulary.preface: 黑水虻的幼蟲會吃廚餘和家畜的廢棄物，對農業大有幫助。

content.text:
1. food 食物.
How should I teach my kid not to waste food? 我要怎麼教小孩別浪費食物?
You want him to eat everything? 你想要他把東西都吃完?
Not everything. 不用吃全部.
But at least the food on his plate. 但至少吃完盤子裡的。

2. great 很棒的。
Make your food taste great? 讓食物很好吃吧?
But I don't want to put in too much salt or sugar.但是我不想放太多鹽或是糖。

3. kind 種類。
Many kinds of food taste great plain.很多種食物原味就很好吃。
Like clams, or corn. 比如說蛤蜊或是玉米。

4. healthy 健康的。
You can make some clam soup with tofu,你可以做蛤蜊豆腐湯，
or corn soup with eggs. 或是玉米湯加蛋。
That sounds healthy. 聽起來很健康。
Yeah, and easy too.對，也很簡單。

vocabulary.postscript:
你還記得今天的單字嗎?
food食物 great很棒的 kind種類 healthy健康的

2. What can frass do?
3. Why isn't frass used in some countries?
options: c. It doesn't help plants grow.

title: The AI Grandma Who Talks and Talks

content.en: Daisy says she's 78. She says she's a grandma. She loves to talk. She can talk on the phone all day!
content.tw: 阿菊說她是個78 歲的老奶奶，很喜歡整天在手機上跟人聊天!

content.en: But Daisy is not a real grandma. She is a chatbot! That's a computer program. It uses AI. Scientists made Daisy to help stop scammers.
content.tw: 但是，阿菊根本不是真人! 而是一個 AI 聊天機器人，科學家發明阿菊來阻擋詐騙電話。

content.en: Scammers say they are helping people, but they are not. They call people to get money. When they call Daisy, she does not make getting her money easy!
content.tw: 詐騙電話說要幫助人其實是騙人的，他們只想騙錢，不過阿菊讓他們無法得逞!

content.en:
Daisy takes a long time to find her glasses. She says she doesn't know how to use her computer. She talks about cookies. She talks about the night sky. She
does not listen well.
content.tw: 阿菊接到詐騙電話時，她會花很多時間找眼鏡、問詐騙集團怎麼用電腦，還會一直聊餅乾、星空這些不相干的事!

content.en: Daisy wastes scammers' time. This way, they have less time to get money from real people. She keeps them busy for hours!
content.tw: 阿菊會一直拖延，浪費詐騙集團好幾小時，讓他們沒有時間打給無辜的民眾騙錢!

content.en: Some scammers get mad. Daisy is so slow! They give up! Scientists say Daisy shows that AI chatbots can help stop scammers!
content.tw: 阿菊動作太慢，很多詐騙集團講到生氣了，只好放棄。聊天機器人成功阻擋詐騙電話!

content.en: Do you hear grandmas talk and talk on the phone? Maybe they are stopping scammers, like Daisy does!
content.tw: 你有聽過老奶奶在電話上說個不停嗎? 也許她們像阿菊一樣，正在阻擋詐騙電話呢!

vocabulary.preface: 聊天機器人可以幫忙阻擋詐騙電話呢!

content.text:
1) call 打電話.
A woman called me yesterday. 昨天有個女的打電話給我.
And? 然後呢? 
She called me aunt, saying she's my niece.

2) talk 談話.
And asking you if you remembered her.還問你記不記得她.
Yeah, how did you know? 對，你怎麼知道? 
She talked about needing money. 她說到需要錢。

3) give up 放棄.
I wanted to cut her off, 我要打斷她,
but she wouldn't give up.但是她不肯放棄。

4) waste 浪費.
I had to tell her not to waste her time. 我不得不告訴她別浪費時間了.
My brother doesn't have any children.我哥哥沒有小孩.
That's good! 真好!

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀今天的單字。
call打電話 talk談話 give up放棄 waste浪費

2. What do scammers want?
3. Why was Daisy made?
options: b. To look for her glasses

title: Ang Lee Wins Special Award

content.en: Everybody has dreams. But not everyone can make their dream come true. Ang Lee is a Taiwanese movie director. He made his dream come true.
content.tw: 實現夢想很不容易，出生台灣的李安，努力實現夢想，成為世界有名的大導演!

content.en: Lee made many kinds of movies. Many are famous! He made "The Hulk." The Hulk is a big, angry green guy! He made "The Life of Pi." Pi is a boy in a boat with a tiger.
content.tw: 李安拍過各種電影，很多都很有名! 像是會暴怒的綠巨人浩克，還有少年 Pi 的奇幻漂流，是一個男孩與老虎在船上的故事。

content.en: Lee is seventy years old now. He's very famous. But when he was young, his life was not easy. He moved to the U.S. It was hard for him to be a movie director there. But he worked and worked. He was a very good director too! People liked his movies. He became successful!
content.tw: 李安今年 70歲，他年輕時搬到美國，經歷很多困難才終於成為導演，電影迷非常喜歡他!

content.en: Lee won many awards. He won another award this year. It's a Lifetime Achievement Award. Lee says it is special to him. That's because other great directors in the U.S. said he should get it.
content.tw: 李安得過許多獎，今年榮獲終生成就獎，他說這是最特別的獎項，因為評審是其他美國導演!

content.en: Taiwan is very proud of Ang Lee. He worked hard to make his dreams come true. Maybe you can make your dreams come true someday too!
content.tw: 台灣人都很驕傲李安，他努力實現夢想，也許你也能實現自己的夢想!

vocabulary.preface: 台灣出生的電影導演李安，最近榮獲大獎。

content.text:
1) life 人生.
Have you ever watched Life of Pi? 你有沒有看過少年Pi的奇幻漂流?
No, is it good? 沒有，好看嗎?
I find it very interesting. 我覺得它很有趣。

2) movie 電影.
It's a strange movie. 它是很奇特的電影.
It's very different. 很不一樣.
It's about a boy and a tiger, right? 它是講一個男孩跟一頭老虎，對嗎?

3) angry 生氣的.
Yeah, and the tiger sometimes gets angry. 對，那頭老虎有時候會生氣。
So the angry tiger ate the boy. 所以生氣的老虎把男孩吃掉了。
No! Go watch it yourself. 沒有! 你自己去看。

4) win 贏得.
Ang Lee won the Best Director Oscar for it. 李安因為這部電影拿到奧斯卡最佳導演獎.
Oh, I love Ang Lee! 我好喜歡李安.
Me too. 我也是。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有看過大導演李安的作品嗎?
life人生 movie電影 angry生氣的 win贏得

2. Which movie is about an angry green man?
3. Who said Ang Lee should get an award this year?

title: Teaching Taiwan to Enjoy the Ocean

content.en: Many people around the world enjoy swimming and playing in the ocean. They play sports and games. They go surfing, sailing, and snorkeling!
content.tw: 你喜歡水上運動嗎?世界上很多人喜歡游泳跟玩水，還有衝浪、駕駛帆船或是浮潛!

content.en: The ocean is fun! And having fun in the ocean is a great way to stay cool in hot weather. But you have to know how to enjoy it safely.
content.tw: 海洋很好玩，而且在夏天玩水特別涼爽，不過你知道怎麼安全地玩水嗎?

content.en: Taiwan is very hot. But many people here don't know how to be safe in the ocean. Many cannot swim. Many don’t go to the ocean.
content.tw: 台灣是個很熱的海島，但很多人不會游泳，也不知道怎麼在海邊安全玩耍。

content.en: But some students in Kenting are learning how to enjoy the ocean safely. Their teacher thinks everyone should learn!
content.tw: 墾丁的一個老師覺得這很重要，所以正在教一些學生學習如何安全地玩水!

content.en: These students are ten years old. Their teacher shows them how to breathe when they're in the water. He teaches them how to float on the water and swim.
content.tw: 這些十歲學生學習換氣跟游泳，以及練習怎麼在海上漂浮。

content.en: He tells them how the water is that day. He tells them where currents are moving in the ocean. The students are careful!
content.tw: 他也告訴學生每天海的狀況，還有海裡不同的水流，他的學生都很小心!

content.en: Now the students can play games! They feel happy and safe in the water.
content.tw: 現在，上過課後，學生知道怎麼在海上玩，而且是安全又可以好玩!

content.en: Do you love the ocean? For happy times, learn how to enjoy it safely!
content.tw: 你喜歡海洋嗎? 如果你想要在海上玩得開心，就要學習怎麼安全地玩水!

vocabulary.preface: 炎熱的海島台灣，最適合安全的水上活動。

content.text:
1) cool 涼爽的。
The ocean looks so cool! 這海看起來真涼快!
I want to get in the water ! 我想要下水。

Wait, here? 等等，就在這兒嗎?
2) water 水。
Why not? 為什麼不行?
I just need to take off my shirt.我只需要脫掉襯衫。

But the water here is not safe.但是這裡的海水不安全。
3) sail 駕駛帆船。
It’s okay. I can swim. 沒有關係，我會游泳。

I know you can. 我知道你會。
But wouldn’t it be better if we go sailing? 不過我們去玩帆船不是更好?
4) sport 運動

Sailing? That’s a fancy sport. 玩帆船? 那是很花俏的運動。
It’s a fun sport for sure. 它絕對是好玩的運動。
Come on, let me show you how to do it.來吧，我來教你怎麼玩。

來跟我一起讀單字。
cool涼爽的 water水 sail駕駛帆船 sport運動

title: World Masters Games Coming to Taiwan

content.en: Let the games begin! This year, the World Masters Games will be in Taiwan! It's the world's biggest event with many sports. It's every four years. And this is the first time it's in Asia!
content.tw: 世界壯年運動會規模很大，四年舉辦一次，今年第一次辦在亞洲，就在台灣!

content.en: This event has 35 sports. Some are team sports, like baseball, basketball, soccer, and volleyball. Some are for one or two athletes, like golf, judo, karate, sailing, surfing, and table tennis. They will be played in six cities, in 69 places!
content.tw: 總共有 35 種運動，有籃球、足球、排球等團體運動，也有高爾夫、柔道、空手道、帆船、衝浪和桌球等運動，總共在 6 個城市 69 個場地進行!

content.en: Almost 26,000 athletes will come. More than 6,000 athletes will come from other countries.
content.tw: 大概 2 萬 6 千個運動員報名，其中 6 千多個是國際運動員。

content.en: Most athletes are 30 years old or older. The oldest is a badminton player from Taiwan. He's 103 years old! He fits the motto for this year's games: "Sports beyond age, life without limits."
content.tw: 大部分選手超過 30 歲，年紀最大的是 103 歲的台灣羽球員，正好符合比賽口號：「壯年來運動，人生無極限！」

content.en: Athletes don't play for a country. They play for themselves. They can make teams with athletes from other countries too.
content.tw: 這些運動員不代表國家，而是以自己的名義參賽，他們也可以和各地的運動員組隊。

content.en: The World Masters Games is from May 17th to May 30th. It's coming soon! And we can go watch the games for free! Let's cheer for the athletes!
content.tw: 世界壯年運動會將在 5 月 17 日到 30 日舉行，大家可以免費去觀賽，為運動員加油!

vocabulary.preface: 世界壯年運動會即將在台北市跟新北市展開，邀請大家去觀賽。

content.text:
1. table tennis 桌球.
I tried table tennis last weekend. 我上週末嘗試打桌球.
How did it go? 結果怎麼樣?
I hit my face twice. 我打到自己的臉兩次.
That's impressive. 這滿厲害的。

2. athlete 運動員.
I thought I was a natural athlete. 我以為我是天生的運動員.
You are pretty good at other sports. 其他的運動你是很行.
Didn't you play soccer in college? 你大學時不是踢足球?

3. team 團隊.
Yeah, I like team sports. 對，我喜歡團隊運動.
At least I have my teammates to blame. 至少有隊友可以怪罪。

4. basketball 籃球.
Truly a sportswoman! 真有運動員精神!
Indeed. 確實是.
And I still play basketball sometimes. 我有時候還打籃球。

What sport do you play?

title: Being Bored Can Be Good for You

content.en: Sometimes you want to do something exciting. But nothing looks fun. That's being bored. People don't like being bored. It doesn't feel good.
content.tw: 你常感覺無聊嗎? 大部分的人不喜歡這種找不到有趣事情的感覺。

content.en: But scientists say being bored can be good for you! Your brain looks for something to do. Maybe you get new ideas! Maybe you find fun things to do!
content.tw: 但科學家說無聊有好處! 當大腦一直找事情做，新的靈感就會跑出來!

content.en: Do you get bored when something is too easy? You can make it a game! Do it faster! Give yourself a little prize when you finish!
content.tw: 有時候做太簡單的事情會無聊，你可以把它變成遊戲! 試著做快一點!或是完成時給自己獎勵!

content.en: How about when something is too hard? You can look for small parts you can do. Take a break. Try again. Ask for help when you need it.
content.tw: 事情太難的時候，可以把它分成小小的任務，休息一下再完成，或找人幫忙。

content.en: And do you get bored when you don't know why you are doing something? For example, at school, maybe you get bored when you don't know why you are learning something. What can you do? Find out how the lesson helps you. This can make school more fun!
content.tw: 要是覺得上學沒有意義所以無聊，你可以去了解課程對自己有什麼幫助，就會覺得有趣了!

content.en: You can think about doing new things. You can make your life more exciting!
content.tw: 你可以想想看要做些什麼新鮮事，讓生活更有趣!

vocabulary.preface: 覺得無聊沒事做嗎? 這很可能會激發你的創造力。

content.text:
1. brain 腦袋。
I'm so bored my brain hurts. 我好無聊，腦袋都痛了。
Do you mean you have a headache? 你是說你頭痛?
Something like that. 差不多。

2. look for 尋找。
Watch TV. 看電視。
I did it for 5 hours. 已經看了五個鐘頭。
Read a book.看書。
My eyes are tired.我眼睛累。
Go bike riding! Look for something fun outside! 去騎腳踏車! 去外面找樂子。

3. how about 如何?
Can't you see it's raining? 你看不出來在下雨?
Then draw.那畫畫吧。
How about I draw a picture of you?我畫一幅你的畫像如何?

4. hard 困難的。
Me? No. You'll make me look ugly. 我? 不要，你會把我畫得很醜。
You're right. Faces are hard. 你說得對，臉很難畫。

你現在不會覺得無聊吧? 來一起讀單字。
brain腦袋 look for尋找 how about如何 hard困難的

2. Why can being bored be good?

title: The Money-Saving Dam Builders

content.en: To keep water in a river, people build walls. These walls are called dams.
content.tw: 人們建築水壩來控制河流的水位。水壩就像一道牆，把河水擋住。

content.en: Dams can also keep water out of rivers.
content.tw: 有時候水壩的功能是讓雨水不要進入河流。

content.en: A river needed a dam. Dirty water was going into the river. And the land near the river was too dry. People planned to build dams in the river. And they planned to make the dry land wet all the time. That kind of land is called wetlands. Lots of animals live in wetlands.
content.tw: 有一條河流需要蓋水壩，因為髒水會流進河裡，附近的土地也太乾了。有了水壩，周圍的土地就會保持潮濕，成為濕地，變成動物的家!

content.en: But the people didn't have money for the dams. In Taiwan's money, they needed 43 million dollars! Seven years passed...
content.tw: 水壩是昂貴的工程，需要台幣 4 千 3 百萬元! 所以過了七年，水壩都還沒蓋。

content.en: But one day, they were surprised! They saw dams! The dams are where the people wanted to build! They keep the dirty water out! They make wetlands! The wetlands are bigger and better than the people planned!
content.tw: 但有一天，水壩自己神奇出現了!它把髒水擋住，還創造了濕地，濕地比人們想像的更大更好!

content.en: Who built the dams? Beavers did! These animals used stones, mud, and wood. They built the dams in a few days. And... they saved the people lots of money!
content.tw: 河狸就是神祕的水壩工人! 牠們用石頭、泥土和木頭蓋出水壩，最棒的是不用錢!

content.en: The people are happy. The river is cleaner. Many animals live in the wetlands. Great job, beavers!
content.tw: 人們很開心，河流變乾淨了，濕地裡有很多動物。謝謝你們，河狸!

vocabulary.preface: 河狸天生就會在河流裡建築水壩，作為自己的家。

content.text:
1. wetland 濕地.
I'm going to Ao-Gu Wetland tomorrow. 我明天要去鰲鼓濕地.
To see the birds? 去賞鳥嗎?
Yeah, and take some photos too. 對，也要去拍照。

2. surprised 驚訝的.
I'm surprised that you're still doing that.我很驚訝你還在做那些.
Well, birds are cute. 鳥類很可愛啊。

3. all the time 一直.
They walk around in the water, 牠們在水裡走來走去,
eating all the time. 一直吃個不停.
And you just stand there watching. 而你就站在那裏看.
Yeah. 對。

4. animal 動物.
Surely you have better things to do. 你一定有更好的事可以做吧.
Hey, it's nature! 那是大自然耶.
Lots of water, blue skies, and animals. 有大片的水,藍天,還有動物.
I just love it out there! 我好喜歡那裏!

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我讀單字。
wetland濕地 surprised驚訝的 all the time一直 animal動物

2. What did the beavers use to build the dams?
options: c. Stones, dry land, and wood

title: A New Kind of Olympics Is Coming

content.en: Last year, the best athletes from many countries took part in the Summer Olympics. All athletes trained hard. Taiwan did very well. Our athletes won seven medals!
content.tw: 去年有超精彩的夏季奧林匹克運動會，台灣運動員得了 7 個獎牌!

content.en: The Olympics are great for sports. Fans watch their favorite athletes. They want to play sports like them. Many fans train. They become better at sports!
content.tw: 奧運讓人們更加熱愛運動，他們為喜歡的運動員加油，自己也會練習運動!

content.en: Now a new kind of Olympics is coming! But these Olympics are NOT for sports. Get ready for the World English Language Olympics!
content.tw: 現在有個新的奧林匹克比賽，不是運動會哦!而是世界英文大賽!

content.en: The best young English language learners from many countries can take part. All learners will train hard.
content.tw: 各國學習英文的年輕人都可以參加，他們要很認真訓練!

content.en: But who are the best young English language learners? How will each country find them? Well, each country will have its own Olympics! The winners will take part in the World English Language Olympics.
content.tw: 但怎麼選出國家代表呢?選手要先贏得國內的奧林匹克比賽，非常刺激!

content.en: These country Olympics and the world Olympics will be great for learning English. Fans will watch their favorite learners! They will want to speak like them! Many fans will train. They will become better at English!
content.tw: 這個比賽也會鼓勵人們學英文，他們會支持喜歡的選手，也會因此認真學習英文!

content.en: Start training! The World English Language Olympics are coming!
content.tw: 開始訓練吧! 世界英文大賽就要來了!

vocabulary.preface: 科學家發現土星有兩百多顆月球繞著它轉，有夠熱鬧。

content.text:
1) summer 夏天。
I'm taking part in an English competition this summer.
Really? That's so cool! 真的嗎?好酷喔!
So what's your goal? 所以你的目標是什麼?

2) best 最好的。
To win the first prize, of course!
But the first prize in what? 什麼的第一名呢?
The best English speaker in the world. 全世界最佳英語演講者。

3) train 訓練。
How do you plan to train yourself?
By speaking to you! 就對著你講。
No, spare me. 不，饒了我吧。

4) fan 粉絲。
Didn't you say you're my biggest fan?
I said no such thing! 我才沒說過這種話!
Please, I can't win without you. 拜託，沒有你我不能贏。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字好用又好記。
summer夏天 best最好的 train訓練 fan粉絲

title: Taiwan Fights Noise with Sound Cameras

content.en: Urgh! What is that sound! Oh! That noise is so loud!
content.tw: 天啊! 這聲音太大聲太刺耳了!

content.en: Many people don't like loud noises. Some people tell our government. Last year, more than 100,000 people did that! Many said cars, trucks, or motorcycles were too loud. Others said sounds from building things like houses were too loud.
content.tw: 噪音讓人煩躁，去年有 10 萬個人向政府投訴! 汽車、貨車、摩托車很吵，施工的聲音也是!

content.en: The government is listening to these people. It has a plan to make Taiwan less noisy!
content.tw: 政府聽了大家的心聲，想出一個讓台灣安靜一點的方法!

content.en: First, it will buy 400 sound cameras! It has 200 now. One sound camera costs $1 million to $2 million Taiwan dollars! This plan needs all six hundred cameras!
content.tw: 首先會買 400 台聲音攝影機，一台要花 1 百萬到 2 百萬台幣! 加上本來就有的 2 百台，總共有 6 百台!

content.en: Next, it will use the sound cameras to find noisy places. Sound cameras will record the noise that people or things make. They will also show how loud noises are. And they will show where noises are coming from!
content.tw: 再來，聲音攝影機會錄下路上的噪音，顯示它們有多大聲，還有追蹤噪音從哪裡來!

content.en: The government will make a noise map. This map will show where the noisy places are. The government will watch the noisy places. Then it will find the people making loud noises!
content.tw: 政府會作出噪音地圖，關注最吵的地方，找出不斷製造噪音的人!

content.en:
A less noisy Taiwan sounds great!
Voice: Shhhhhh! Narrator: Oh! Sorry …!
content.tw: 一個安靜的台灣聽起來很棒!

preface.text: 噪音讓很多人受不了，現在有辦法來抓噪音來源。

content.text:
1) loud 大聲的。
Did you hear that sound last night? 你有沒有聽到昨晚那個聲音?
Yeah, it was so loud! 有，超大聲的。
What happened? 發生了什麼事?

2) motorcycle 摩托車。
I think a car hit a motorcycle.我想是一輛車撞上了摩托車。
Gosh! Was the biker okay? 天哪，摩托車騎士還好嗎?
That I don't know. I did hear a police car. 這我不知道。確實有聽到警車。

3) record 紀錄。
Cameras can show who was at fault. 攝影機會顯示誰犯錯。
They record everything. 它們什麼都錄。

4) camera 攝影機。
I didn't know there were cameras on our street. 我不知道我們的街上有攝影機。
Oh yes, cameras are everywhere. 有的，到處都有攝影機。

postscript.text:
今天的單字你記住了嗎?
loud大聲的 motorcycle摩托車 record紀錄 camera攝影機

2. How many sound cameras will the government buy?
3. What will the government do with the sound cameras?

title: Monkeys Like Grandma's Oden Shop

content.en: Oh no! The monkeys are here! Gah! They're taking our food!
content.tw: 猴子來襲!牠們來搶我們的食物了!

content.en: On a mountain In Kaohsiung, a grandma sells oden. Oden is many delicious things in a big pot of soup. Yum! She's had her oden shop for 30 years. Every day, she brings out tofu, fishcakes, radish, and a BB gun!
content.tw: 高雄的山裡有一個阿嬤在賣關東煮，賣了 30年，每天她會準備豆腐、魚餃、白蘿蔔，還有一把 BB 槍!

content.en: Many monkeys live on the mountain. And they like places where there's lots of food! So they visit grandma's shop!
content.tw: 山裡很多猴子，牠們喜歡吃人類的食物，牠們會拜訪阿嬤的店。

content.en: Grandma cooks, washes dishes, and keeps her food safe. She does this all day. This seventy-one-year-old grandma is busy! And when she's not looking, monkeys come in! They take food! Having a shop that monkeys like is hard.
content.tw: 71 歲的阿嬤每天煮菜洗碗，已經很辛苦了，但猴子都會趁她不注意時，把關東煮偷走!

content.en: Grandma gets her BB gun. She poses like a gunfighter. People watch. She looks like she's making a movie!
content.tw: 阿嬤會拿出 BB 槍，擺出像動作片明星的架式，大家都圍過來看!

content.en: Grandma wants to scare the monkeys! She shoots! But she does not shoot the monkeys…
content.tw: 阿嬤開槍! 但不是射向猴子，她只想把猴子們嚇走，不會傷害牠們。

content.en: The monkeys are making grandma's work harder. They will come again and again!
content.tw: 這些猴子還是會一直回來，什麼時候阿嬤才能好好放鬆呢?

content.en: How can people and monkeys live happily together? Do you have any ideas?
content.tw: 人類和猴子要怎麼和平共處呢? 你有什麼好點子嗎?

vocabulary.preface: 科學家發現土星有兩百多顆月球繞著它轉，有夠熱鬧。

content.text:
1. take 拿走.
Here comes the monkey! Quickly, hide your food! 猴子來了，趕快把吃的藏起來!
Hey, he took my sandwich! 嘿，他搶走我的三明治!
Out of my hand! 從我手裡搶!

2. again 再度.
Now I only have my soup. 現在我只有湯了。
You'd better protect it.你最好保護好。
He may come again. 他有可能再來。

3. safe 安全的.
How can I keep my food safe?我要怎麼維護食物安全?
You can't. Those monkeys are hungry. 沒辦法，那些猴子餓了。
So am I! 我也是!

4. scare 驚嚇.
Maybe we can throw water at the animal. 也許我們可以對著那隻動物潑水。
Do you think it'll be scared away?你覺得他會被嚇走嗎?
I hope so. 我希望會。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們一起來讀今天的單字。
take拿走 again再度 safe安全的 scare驚嚇

quiz.question: 1. Where is grandma's oden shop?
2. How many years has grandma had her shop?
3. What does grandma do to make the monkeys leave?

title: Too Many Mattresses Making a Mess in Taiwan

content.en: Uhh! This mattress is so bad! Urgh … I can't sleep on it! It's time to throw it away …
content.tw: 這個床墊好爛哦，我要丟掉!

content.en: In Taiwan, we throw away more than 950,000 mattresses every year! Cities are having a hard time with old mattresses.
content.tw: 台灣每年丟掉 95 萬個床墊! 我們面臨舊床墊大災難!

content.en: Mattresses catch on fire very easily! They also have things inside that can make the air, water, and land dirty. Cities pay lots of money to throw mattresses away safely.
content.tw: 床墊很容易著火，床墊裡的填充物也會汙染空氣和水。把床墊安全地處理掉需要花很多錢。

content.en: Throwing them away also takes time. Machines and people break them down. The metal in them is recycled. Everything else is burned safely.
content.tw: 處理舊床墊也很花時間，機器要先分解他們，回收裡面的金屬，剩下的部分燒掉。

content.en: But there are so many mattresses! Mountains of them are growing in many cities. They're ugly. They're bad for the Earth. And they're dangerous! What a mess!
content.tw: 更糟的是，床墊太多，堆積如山! 床墊垃圾山難看又危險，而且對地球有危害。

content.en: Cities need more workers, machines, and money for the mattresses! But experts say mattress makers also need to make mattresses easy to throw away safely. All this will take some time.
content.tw: 政府需要更多人力跟資源來回收床墊，專家說工廠也要改進，做出更容易回收的產品。身為消費者的我們，讓床墊長壽一點，也比較環保。

content.en:
What can we do to help? We can take care of our mattresses so we can use them longer. And we can stop jumping on them!
Mom: Stop jumping!Kid: Awww!
content.tw:
我們可以怎麼幫忙? 我們可以好好照顧床墊，讓它們用得更久。還有，別再跳上去了!
媽媽: 別跳了! 孩子: 哎呀!

vocabulary.preface: 厚厚的床墊一旦變成垃圾，很不好處理。

content.text:
1. recycle 回收。
There's a mattress on the first floor. 一樓有一個床墊。
It's mine. 是我的。
I want to have it recycled. 我要把它回收。
What's wrong with it? 它有什麼不對?
It's dirty. 髒掉了。

2. bad 壞的。
You want to throw it away before you buy a new one? 你買新床墊之前就把它扔掉?
Yeah. 是啊。
Bad idea. 糟糕的主意。
That's okay. 沒關係的。

3. sleep 睡覺。
I can sleep on the sofa. 我可以睡沙發。
Another bad idea. 又是一個壞主意。
You won't sleep well. 你會睡不好。

4. many 很多的。
And you have too many opinions! 而你意見太多!
It's better than having none. 總比什麼意見都沒有好。

2. What are growing in many Taiwan cities?
3. What can we do with our mattresses to help?

postscript:
你有注意到自己用什麼床墊嗎? 請跟我讀今天的單字。
recycle回收 bad壞的 sleep睡覺 many很多的

title: Whales are Picky Eaters

content.en: Whales are Picky Eaters
content.tw: 鯨魚很挑食

content.en: Humpback Whales are big ocean animals. They eat small fish, little shrimp, and other small ocean animals.
content.tw: 座頭鯨是大型海洋動物，牠們會張開嘴大口吃小魚小蝦，還有其他小動物。

content.en: They can't eat big things. They don't have teeth. And their throats are small. Big things can't go in. So they find small things to eat.
content.tw: 那是因為牠們喉嚨很小，還沒有牙齒，所以不能吃大的食物。

content.en: One day, a father and son were riding small boats in the ocean. They were having a great time! Then something very big came out of the water!
content.tw: 一個爸爸帶孩子在海上駕駛小船，玩得正開心時，一個龐然大物出現在海上!

content.en: It was a Humpback Whale! It took the son into its mouth. Then it went under the water again. That was scary!
content.tw: 竟然是一隻座頭鯨! 天啊! 牠的大嘴把孩子帶走，然後消失在水中。

content.en: But the whale didn't want to eat anything so big. It quickly let the son go. He came up out of the water. He was safe! The father and son were very surprised!
content.tw: 但這隻鯨魚不吃這麼大的東西，很快放孩子離開，爸爸和孩子都很驚喜他撿回一命!

content.en: The father's video camera was on his boat. It filmed everything! They put the video on social media. People around the world saw it!
content.tw: 船上的攝影機錄下整個過程，他們把影片放上社群媒體，迅速在全球爆紅。

content.en: Scientists think the whale was surprised by the son in its mouth. The son doesn't want to surprise a whale again. He's going to be very careful from now on!
content.tw: 科學家認為鯨魚被嘴裡的孩子嚇到了，孩子也不想再嚇到鯨魚了，從今以後會很小心!

vocabulary.preface: 年輕人被座頭鯨吸進嘴裡，還好沒有幾秒就吐了出來。

content.text:
1. mouth 嘴巴。
Can you imagine going into a whale's mouth?你能想像跑進鯨魚的嘴裡嗎?
And then coming out? Yeah, it's crazy! 然後又出來? 確實很瘋狂!

2. teeth 牙齒。
The son is really lucky! 那個兒子真幸運!
He's lucky that the whale doesn't have teeth. 他很幸運，鯨魚沒有牙齒。
If it were a shark...如果是鯊魚...

3. ocean 海洋。
That would be very scary! 那會很恐怖的!
Yeah, the ocean can be a dangerous place. 對啊，海洋有可能很危險。

4. one day 有一天。
But I remember reading the book "Pinocchio." 不過我記得讀木偶奇遇記。
The little boy finds his father inside a whale one day.
小男孩有一天在鯨魚肚子裡找到爸爸。
I love that story! 我很喜歡那個故事!

vocabulary.postscript:
你記得今天的單字嗎?
mouth嘴巴 teeth牙齒 ocean海洋 one day有一天

options: a. Humpback Whales don't like big animals.
b. Humpback Whale throats are small.

quiz.question: 2. What did the Humpback Whale do with the son?
3. What do scientists think about the Humpback Whale?
options: b. It wanted to eat a man.

title: After Long Wait, Taichung School Gets New Sports Field

content.en: In 2004, a big typhoon hit Taiwan. It hurt many people. It destroyed many homes and businesses. Taichung was one of the cities the big typhoon hit. The wind and rain were very strong! The typhoon destroyed an elementary school sports field!
content.tw: 2004 年有一個大颱風襲擊台灣，台中受到很大損失，一座小學操場被風雨毀掉!

content.en: This typhoon hurt Taichung very badly. People there had to build their city again. They cleaned up roads. They fixed buildings. They took care of family and friends who were hurt.
content.tw: 台中人努力重建城市，他們清理道路、重新蓋大樓，還有照顧受傷的民眾。

content.en: The school and the local people tried to fix the sports field. But fixing it was not easy. There were many problems. They took a lot of time.
content.tw: 而那座小學也試著修理操場，但是問題太多了，花了很多時間。

content.en: Now it's 21 years after the big typhoon. And it's an exciting time for the school and the local people!
content.tw: 現在過了 21 年，學校迎接一個讓人興奮的時刻!

content.en: The school will have a very nice new sports field by the end of the year! After waiting for so long, the kids and the local people will be able to enjoy having a sports field.
content.tw: 今年年底學校會有新操場！學生和當地民眾終於能好好享受運動。

content.en: Everyone can have fun together at Taichung's newest school sports field!
content.tw: 大家可以一起在台中最新的小學操場上玩得開心!

vocabulary.preface: 小學操場被颱風摧毀之後二十一年，終於重建。

content.text:
1. field 操場.
Oh boy, look at this field! 天哪，你看這個操場!
It's totally destroyed! 全部毀掉了。
Well, it's not that bad. 也沒那麼糟糕。

2. hurt 受傷的.
Just some fallen trees and running tracks with big
holes.只有一些倒下的樹，跑道上有幾個大洞。
I hope no children got hurt. 希望沒有小孩受傷。

3. clean up 清理.
They'd better clean up this place fast. 他們最好趕快把這裡清理乾淨。
Workers must be very busy today. 工人今天一定都很忙。

4. hit 打擊.
No typhoon holiday for them. 他們沒有颱風假。
How many typhoons have hit us so far? 到現在為止有幾個颱風來?
Four, I think. 我想有四個。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有見過很恐怖的颱風嗎? 來一起讀單字。
field操場 hurt受傷的 clean up清理 hit打擊

quiz.question: 1. In this story, when did the big typhoon hit Taichung?
2. What did the big typhoon do to a school sports field?
3. When can people enjoy the new sports field?
options: b. At the end of this year
c. At the end of next year
